extendedIngredients.name: green chilies
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chilies, drained

recipes.title: Corn Bread Sloppy Joes
recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Prepare and bake corn bread according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Stir in the spaghetti sauce, corn, chilies and sloppy joe mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.                                                                                            Sprinkle with cheese; cover and cook for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Cut corn bread into six pieces; cut each piece in half. Top with sloppy joe mixture.                                        Yield: 6 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Corn Bread Sloppy Joes in  Weeknight Cooking Made EasyAnnual 2005, p36                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 cup sloppy joe mixture with 2 pieces of corn bread equals 592 calories, 25 g fat (12 g saturated fat), 142 mg cholesterol, 1,658 mg sodium, 54 g carbohydrate, 4 g fiber, 38 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Prepare and bake corn bread according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Stir in the spaghetti sauce, corn, chilies and sloppy joe mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese; cover and cook for 1 minute or until cheese is melted.
Cut corn bread into six pieces; cut each piece in half. Top with sloppy joe mixture.
